greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of weakly unimodal partitions of n in which the greatest part occurs exactly k times, n>=1, 1<=k<=n.
comment: These are called stack polyominoes in the Flajolet and Sedgewick reference.
reference: P. Flajolet and R Sedgewick, Analytic Combinatorics, Cambridge Univ. Press, 2009, page 46.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
formula: For fixed k>=1, T(n,k) ~ Pi^(k-1) * (k-1)! * exp(2*Pi*sqrt(n/3)) / (2^(k+2) * 3^(k/2 + 1/4) * n^(k/2 + 3/4)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 24 2018
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; local r; expand(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=1..n))(b(n, 1)):
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Nov 29 2014
